info.title: About Waist-to-Hip Ratio
info.description: The waist-to-hip ratio (WHR) is a measurement of body fat distribution. It is calculated by dividing waist circumference by hip circumference. A high WHR indicates more fat stored around the waist, which is associated with increased risk of health problems such as cardiovascular disease and type 2 diabetes.
info.formula: Formula: WHR = waist circumference / hip circumference
info.limitations: WHR is a useful screening tool, but should be used alongside other health measures. It doesn't account for total body composition or other individual factors. Consult with a healthcare professional for a complete assessment.
